snippet: Imelda Staunton, who has avoided musicals for most of her career, now finds herself, at 56, a leading interpreter of Sondheim women.
abstract: British actress Imelda Staunton had shunned musical theater until she was cast in the current New York production of Stephen Sondheim's Sweeney Todd, where her performance was so successful that she has been persuaded to take on other singing roles.
lead_paragraph: Imelda Staunton, who has avoided musicals for most of her career, now finds herself, at 56, a leading interpreter of Sondheim women.

headline.seo: Imelda Staunton on Return to Musicals With Sondheim Roles
headline.main: Don’t Shun a Gift Horse, Even if It’s Singing
headline.print_headline: Don’t Shun a Gift Horse, Even if It’s Singing
